Module.name: sketch

Class.name: Sketch
Class.span: Represents an interactive animation that runs in the Pygame window; supports sprites and GUI controls. In addition to the attributes described here, this class inherits the attributes of its superclass, PApplet.

Method.name: Sketch(setup)
Method.span: The constructor creates a Sketch instance from a setup function. Use the play method to play the sketch.
Method.Arg: An unbound function that initializes the sketch. A reference to the sketch.

Class.Method: Redraws the background and all visible sprites, and then updates all enabled sprites.

Method.name: physicsDraw()
Method.span: Calls simpleDraw and then updates colliding masses based on simplified 2D physics.

Method.name: drawWall(color, weight)
Method.span: Draw a wall around the edges of the sketch; called automatically by simpleDraw.
Method.Arg: The color to use for rendering the wall.
The thickness of the wall in pixels.

Class.Method:
Specifies a new drawing function and event map to control the animation. An unbound function that draws one frame of the animation. A reference to the sketch.
A dictionary that maps event types or classes (keys) to handler functions (values). You can use None as a key to specify a handler for events that do not have a custom handler.

Changes the display size and optionally the mode as well. Adjusts the size to match the aspect ratio of the background image and scales all sprites to the new sketch size. A tuple specifying the desired size of the sketch. An integer specifying the desired display mode. Set this to pygame.RESIZABLE to make the sketch user resizable, or to 0 to keep the size fixed. When the called by the play method as a result of a user resize event, the event instance is passed; resize will add an adjustSize attribute to the event if it needs to modify the requested size to match the background image aspect ratio.

Method.name: sound(key, cache, **kwargs) → pygame.mixer.Sound
Method.span: Loads and plays a sound file.
Method.Arg: The name of the sound file, or the key if playing a cached sound.
Specifies whether to keep the sound object in the cache.

Arg.name: kwargs
Arg.span: Additional arguments to be passed to the sound’s play method.

Method.name: loadSounds(*args)
Method.span: Pre-load a sound file into the cache.

Arg.name: args
Arg.span: A sequence of strings specifying the files to load. Alternatively, any string can be replaced by a 2-tuple containing the file name and a key to be used to reference the sound instead of its file name.

Method.name: prompt(msg, validator, default, title, minSize, **kwargs)
Method.span: Request asynchronous user input in a GUI dialog. This method is described in detail in the tutorial.
Method.Arg: Text to display as a prompt.
A type or function to validate the raw input.
Default response to display.
The dialog title.
The minimum size of the dialog.

Method.name: fileDialog(mode, allowCancel, initFilter)
Method.span: Run an asynchronous GUI dialog to select a file or folder. This method is described in detail in the tutorial.

Arg.name: mode
Arg.span: One of the constants OPEN, SAVE, FOLDER.

Method.Arg: specifies whether the user can cancel the dialog without selecting a file or folder.
A pattern that specifies which files to display.

PropA.name: wall
PropA.span: Assign a color to this property to create a wall around the sketch. Call the setBackground method after setting the wall color to draw the wall. This property affects the default edge behaviour of sprites.

PropR.name: frameNumber
PropR.span: The number of frames that have been drawn (including the current frame) since the animate method was last called.

PropR.name: draw
PropR.span: A reference to the current drawing function. Use the animate method to change the drawing function.

PropR.name: sprites
PropR.span: A reference to the SpriteList instance that represents all sprites currently in the sketch.

PropR.name: io
PropR.span: A reference to the GUI dialog object created by the prompt or fileDialog methods. Will be None when no such dialog is running.

Represents a graphical object or character that can be drawn on top of the sketch background and is capable of interaction. The constructor creates a Sprite instance from the costume argument. A reference to the Sketch or SpriteList instance to which the sprite is being added. An image, sequence of images, or file name specifying the sprite’s costumes. A sequence of set instances representing the group(s) to which the sprite belongs. A dictionary of the sprite’s initial properties.
Modifies the sprite’s assignable properties as specified by kwargs. Advances the sprite’s properties by one frame; for example, if the sprite has a spin property it will be used to recalculate the sprite’s angle property. Return the current size of the sprite. A bool specifying whether the size is to be calculated before (False) or after (True) the sprite image is rotated.
Returns whether the sprite’s shape model contains any of the specified points. The points to be compared to the sprite’s outline.
Returns a vector (as a 2-tuple of numbers) of the specified magnitude pointing from the sprite’s position toward the specified point. This can be used to set the velocity or accel properties to make the sprite move toward a certain location. The point toward which the vector points. The magnitude of the vector.
Specify the order in which the sprite’s costumes are to be changed. This can be the sequence of costumes as a list or tuple, or the index of the first costume to be displayed. The index of the last costume in the sequence; only used if the costume argument is an int. Specifies whether the sequence is to repeated in reverse order.
Determine whether the sprite is colliding with any of the sprites in group. A sequence of sprites to check for collisions; if None, all sprites in the sketch sprite list are checked. A function used to determine if a collision is occurring.
Returns a collection of sprites from the specified group that are colliding with the current sprite. A sequence of sprites to check for collisions; if None, all sprites in the sketch sprite list are checked. A function used to determine if a collision is occurring. Specifies the desired class of the collection; i.e. tuple, list, etc.
A generator version of the collisions method. Scales and translates the sprite; this method is called automatically when the sketch is resized. A vector describing the translation to apply. A number describing the scale transformation.
Remove the sprite from the sprite list; should not be called while iterating through the sprites.
Move the sprite to the end of the sprite list so that is drawn as the top layer; should not be called while iterating through the sprites.
Specify that the sprite’s shape model for collisions is a circle. The radius of the shape model relative to the actual image (costume) size.
Specify that the sprite’s shape model for collisions is a polygon. A sequence of ordered pairs describing the outline of the sprite on the unzoomed and unrotated costume; these points must be in clockwise order for collision physics to work properly.
Specify as the shape model a polygon which approximates an ellipse. A positive number specifying how “full” the shape is; a value of 1 is a proper ellipse, larger values are more rectangular, and smaller values are more cross-shaped. A 2-tuple specifying the size of the shape model relative to the original costume width and height. The number of vertices in the model polygon.
Calculate the combined translational plus rotational velocity of the sprite at the specified coordinates. Coordinates of the point at which the velocity is to be calculated.
This method is called by the image getter to apply any effects to the sprite’s image after being scaled and rotated; by default it returns the image without modifications but can be overridden by subclasses. An Image instance to be modified.
Draws the sprite to a surface; called automatically by the SpriteList.draw method. The surface on which to draw the sprite.
A reference to a function that updates the sprite’s properties whenever a frame is drawn. A sequence of images representing the sprite’s “costumes”; returns a list. The index specifying the sprite’s current costume. The period (number of frames) at which the costume changes. A color or RGB tuple specifying a color tint to apply to the sprite image. The mass of the sprite to be used for physics-based collisions. An ordered pair describing the sprite’s position within the sketch. An ordered pair describing the sprite’s velocity. An ordered pair describing the sprite’s acceleration. An ordered pair describing the rate of change of the sprite’s position. The size of the sprite relative to the size of the costume image. The width of the zoomed, unrotated sprite. The height of the zoomed, unrotated sprite. The relative rate at which the zoom property changes. For example, a value of -0.01 decreases the zoom value by 1% per frame. The number of degrees clockwise to rotate the sprite’s costume before drawing it. Negative values indicate counter-clockwise rotation. The number of degrees by which the angle property changes per frame. Indicates whether to recalculate the angle property to match the direction of the velocity. The proportion of the “kinetic energy” to conserve on BOUNCE actions and collisions. An amount by which to reduce the velocity each frame. For example, a value of 0.01 reduces the velocity by 1% each frame. An amount by which to reduce the spin each frame. An int constant indicating whether the sprite is to be drawn and/or updated. Values are VISIBLE, HIDDEN, or DISABLED. An int constant indicating what action is to be taken when the sprite reaches the edge of the sketch. A value of 0 indicates no action; other constants are BOUNCE, WRAP, and REMOVE. This property can be a bitwise combination of x and y behaviours; e.g. BOUNCE_X | WRAP_Y. The default value is determined by the sketch’s wall property at the time the sprite is created. Specifies whether to check for overlapping blit rectangles in determining collisions before examining the sprite’s shape model; should be set to False if the shape model extends outside the blit rectangle. For efficiency it is updated only once per frame, immediately before the sprite is blitted to the display. The current zoomed size of the sprite as a (width, height) tuple. An image of the sprite’s current costume that has been zoomed and rotated according to the sprite properties. A Polygon2D or Circle2D instance describing the sprite’s shape model. This property is set to True or False by the frameStep method to indicate whether or not the sprite’s properties have been adjusted as a result of an edge effect (e.g. BOUNCE, WRAP, etc.). Return the magnitude of the sprite’s velocity. Return the sprite’s moment of intertia. Return the sprite’s kinetic energy. A reference to the Sketch instance to which the sprite belongs. A reference to the SpriteList instance to which the sprite belongs.

Class.name: SpriteList
Class.span: Represents the sequence of sprites that have been added to a sketch. The sketch’s sprites attribute is a reference to the SpriteList instance, which is created automatically by the Sketch constructor. The sprite list supports indexing.

Method.name: remove(sprites) → set
Method.span: Remove one or more sprites and return the removed sprites as a set.
Method.Arg: A sprite or sequence of sprites to be removed.

Method.name: empty() → set
Method.span: Remove all sprites and return them as a set.

Method.name: append(sprite, *groups) → self
Method.span: Add a sprite to the end of the sprite list and to any specified groups. Called automatically by the Sprite constructor.
Method.Arg: A sprite to be appended.
Sets of sprites to which the sprite is to be added.

Method.name: config(sprites, **kwargs)
Method.span: Call the Sprite.config method for a sequence of sprites.

Arg.name: sprites
Arg.span: The sprites to configure, as an iterable; if None all sprites are configured.

Arg.name: kwargs
Arg.span: A dictionary of properties to be passed to each sprites config method.

Method.name: action(sprites, func, **kwargs)
Method.span: Call a function on each of a sequence of sprites.

Arg.name: sprites
Arg.span: The sprites on which the action is to be performed, as an iterable; if None all sprites are used.

Method.Arg: A function that will accept a sprite and additional keyword arguments.
A dictionary of keyword arguments to be passed to the function.

Method.name: draw(srf)
Method.span: Draw all of the sprites, and if the run property is True update all sprites’ properties.

Arg.name: srf
Arg.span: A surface on which to draw the sprites; if None the Pygame display will be used.

Method.name: transform(shift, factor)
Method.span: Perform a translation and/or scale transformation on all sprites; called automatically by Sketch.resize.
Method.Arg: The amount of translation to perform.
The scale transformation factor.

Class.Method: Return a sprite or list of sprites located at the specified position. A 2-tuple describing the position at which to look for sprites. Specifies whether to return a list of all sprites located at the specified position, or just the top-most sprite.

Method.name: physics() → dict
Method.span: Identify all colliding sprites with a non-zero mass property and update their properties according to a simplified 2D physics model; returns a mapping of collisions.

Class.Method: Return a set of sprites currently involved in collisions. An iterable of sprites to check for collisions; if None all sprites are checked. A function used to determine if a collision is occurring.

Checks for collisions between two groups of sprites; returns a 2-tuple of sets containing those sprites from each group currently colliding with a sprite from the other group. An iterable of sprites to check for collisions; if None all sprites are checked. An iterable of sprites to check for collisions; if None, group2 is assumed to be the same as group1. A function used to determine if a collision is occurring.

Method.name: collisionMap(group1, group2, collided) → dict
Method.span: Checks for collisions between two groups of sprites; returns a mapping of collisions with group1 sprites as keys.

Arg.name: group1
Arg.span: An iterable of sprites to check for collisions; if None all sprites are checked.

Arg.name: group2
Arg.span: An iterable of sprites to check for collisions; if None, group2 is assumed to be the same as group1.

Method.Arg: A function used to determine if a collision is occurring.

Class.PropA: Specifies whether to update all sprites’ properties after drawing.

Module.Function: Determines whether two sprites are colliding based on whether their blit rectangles are overlapping. This is the simplest (i.e. fastest) but least accurate collision detection. A Sprite instance. A second Sprite instance.

Function.name: collide_shape(left, right) → bool
Function.span: Determines whether two sprites are colliding based on whether their shape models overlap. For efficiency, shapes are checked only when the blit rectangles are determined to overlap.

Function.name: collide_shape_only(left, right) → bool
Function.span: Determines whether two sprites are colliding based on whether their shape models overlap. This function does not check the blit rectangles, making it slower. Useful when the shape model extends outside the blit rectangle.

Constant.name: VISIBLE
Constant.span: Used as a Sprite instance’s status property to indicate that the sprite is to be drawn and updated.

Constant.name: HIDDEN
Constant.span: Used as a Sprite instance’s status property to indicate that the sprite is to be updated but not drawn.

Constant.name: DISABLED
Constant.span: Used as a Sprite instance’s status property to indicate that the sprite is not to be drawn or updated.
